data.title: Magic Array
data.statement:
A <<Magic array>> is an array in which the sum of the prime numbers in the array is equal to the first element of the array.

(Quick reminder: A prime number [[n]] is a positive integer that is only divisible by 1 and [[n]])
Note that 0 and 1 are not considered prime numbers, and if the first element is a prime number, it is also taken into account for the sum.

So {21, 3, 7, 9, 11, 4, 6} is a magic array because 3, 7, 11 are prime numbers in the array and their sum is 21 which is the first element of the array. (13, 4, 4, 4, 4} is also a magic array because the sum of the prime numbers is 13 which is also the first element.

{8, 5, -5, 5, 3}  is not a magic array because the sum of the prime numbers is 5+5+3 = 13. Note that -5 is not a prime number because prime numbers are positive.

If there are no prime numbers in the array, the array is a magic array if the first element is 0.

Write a program to print {{true}} or {{false}} based on whether the given array is magic array or not.
data.constraints:
-50 ≤ [[value of elements in array]] ≤ 50
0 < [[length of line]] ≤ 100
data.inputDescription: A space separated list of integers.
data.outputDescription: A single line containing {{true}} if the given array is a  magic array or {{false}} if it isn't.

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

A Magic array is an array in which the sum of the prime numbers in the array is equal to the first element of the array.

(Quick reminder: A prime number n is a positive integer that is only divisible by 1 and n)
Note that 0 and 1 are not considered prime numbers, and if the first element is a prime number, it is also taken into account for the sum.

So {21, 3, 7, 9, 11, 4, 6} is a magic array because 3, 7, 11 are prime numbers in the array and their sum is 21 which is the first element of the array. (13, 4, 4, 4, 4} is also a magic array because the sum of the prime numbers is 13 which is also the first element.

{8, 5, -5, 5, 3} is not a magic array because the sum of the prime numbers is 5+5+3 = 13. Note that -5 is not a prime number because prime numbers are positive.

If there are no prime numbers in the array, the array is a magic array if the first element is 0.

Write a program to print true or false based on whether the given array is magic array or not.
Input
A space separated list of integers.
Output
A single line containing true if the given array is a magic array or false if it isn't.
Constraints
-50 ≤ value of elements in array ≤ 50
0 < length of line ≤ 100
Example
Input
21 3 7 9 11 4 6
Output
true
